Description: The Temptation of St Antony; the saint seated at right; the pig with a bell at far right; at left two nude female figures and a devilish figure offering goblets and a bowl to the saint; landscape background with a stag and rabbit in middle distance. c.1505/8 Woodcut
Producer name: Block cut by: Jost de Negker
Curator's comments: See D. Petherbridge, 'Witches and Wicked Bodies'. Exhibition catalogue Edinburgh 2013, cat No. 9
Bibliographic references: Hollstein / German engravings, etchings and woodcuts c.1400-1700 (4)
Dodgson 1903, 1911 / Catalogue of Early German and Flemish Woodcuts in the BM, 2 vols (II.207.1)
Exhibition history: 1983 Jun-Aug, Washington, 'Lucas Van Leyden and His Contemporaries', cat.134 1983 Sep-Nov, Boston, 'Lucas Van Leyden and His Contemporaries' 2013 Aug - Nov, Edinburgh, Scottish NG, Witches and Wicked Bodies 2014-15 Sept - Jan, London, BM, Witches and Wicked Bodies
Associated names: Representation of: St Antony of Egypt
